alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 08 at 3:06PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: .Periods of heavy rain are forecast to continue moving into south central Alaska through the end of the week and could cause areas of elevated river conditions and flooding through Saturday. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, Copper River Basin. This includes the cities of Glennallen, Eureka, Mccarthy, Paxson, And Slana. * WHEN...Through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks and flooding may occur in areas of poor drainage and across low roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Light to Moderate rain has started to fall in the Copper River Valley as of Thursday afternoon. The heaviest rain will extend through Friday morning. Storm totals of between 2 and 4 inches of rain are expected near Chitina, and north along the Denali Highway. Expect up to 4 to 6 inches in the higher elevations near McCarthy. This rain event could push smaller streams and creeks near Richardson Highway, Edgerton Highway, MCarthy Road and eastern Denali Highway above bankfull with flooding possible. - Http://www.weather.gov/aprfc
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Please do not drive through flooded areas, turn around, don`t drown.
